title: SOPFFO the Clown
itunes:title: SOPFFO the Clown
description:
The coming of March has blessed us with an end-of-fiscal bounty of games, as we spend a bunch of this week’s episode digging deep into Ghostwire: Tokyo, Tunic, and the ever-baffling Stranger of Paradise: Final Fantasy Origin. Plus: Vinny’s late-game Horizon thoughts, some speculation about this summer’s E3 window, a quick look at the Dead Space remake, and, uh, it’s raining dinosaurs?

Advertise on The Nextlander Podcast at Gumball.fm, or support us on Patreon!

CHAPTERS

(00:00:00) NOTE: Some timecodes may be inaccurate in versions other than the ad-free Patreon version due to dynamic ad insertions. Please use caution if skipping aroun
d to avoid spoilers. Thanks for listening.
(00:00:10) Intro
(00:01:57) Alex came to my house and killed my Xbox
(00:09:18) In the same room? Like, together?
(00:11:10) Show rundown
(00:12:47) The games
(00:12:52) GhostWire: Tokyo [PC (Microsoft Windows), PlayStation 5] on Mar 25, 2022
(00:30:44) First Break
(00:30:48) Tunic [Xbox Series X|S, PC (Microsoft Windows), Mac, Xbox One] on Mar 16, 2022
(00:47:41) Stranger of Paradise: Final Fantasy Origin [PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X|S, PC (Microsoft Windows)] on Mar 18, 2022
(01:02:00) Horizon Forbidden West [PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4] on Feb 18, 2022
(01:07:47) Second Break
(01:07:51) News
(01:08:33) Sony's State of Play
(01:08:55) Returnal getting co-op
(01:10:00) Exoprimal (that dinosaurs dropping out of the sky game)
(01:10:55) Dino Crisis producer involved with Exoprimal
(01:12:50) Perfect Dark reboot development woes
(01:17:28) No EA Play Live this year
(01:21:50) More Dead Space gets shown
(01:26:21) Xbox will be able to download updates in Energy Saver mode
(01:31:01) New Supermassive game with Lance Henriksen?
(01:34:21) Show recap
(01:35:41) Wrapping up and thanks
(01:36:37) Mysterious Benefactor Shoutouts
(01:38:20) Nextlander content updates
(01:42:09) See Ya!

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
